alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henry; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 12 at 3:25PM EST until January 12 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...SE Winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph becoming SW 20 to 30 mph with occasional gusts to 60 mph this evening. Wind gusts of 40 to 55 mph expected overnight tonight. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, south central and southeast Indiana. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, until 4 PM EST this afternoon. For the High Wind Warning, until 8 PM EST this evening. For the second Wind Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to 9 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of stronger winds is expected to push through southeastern and eastern portions of Indiana later this evening associated with a wind shift from SE to SW. Rapid wind shifts and increasing gusts may cause additional damage to weakened trees and structures.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
